d1: The title of the chart indicates the percentage of U.S. Adults living in households with or without a working landline telephone.
d2: The x-axis shows the years from 2009 to 2021, the y-axis shows the percentage of U.S. Adults living in households, and the legend shows the two categories of landline phone and cell phone only.

insight1.insightSentence: The data shows that the percentage of U.S. adults living in households with a working landline phone has decreased from 74% in 2009 to 30.9% in 2021.Meanwhile, the percentage of U.S. adults living in households with only a cell phone has increased from 23.6% in 2009 to 68.35% in 2021.

subInsights.phrases: The percentage of U.S. adults living in households with a working landline phone has decreased from 74% in 2009 to 30.9% in 2021.
The percentage of U.S. adults living in households with only a cell phone has increased from 23.6% in 2009 to 68.35% in 2021.

insight2.insightSentence: This suggests that there has been a consistent trend in recent years of people moving away from landline phones and towards cell phones.

subInsights.phrases: This suggests that there has been a consistent trend in recent years of people moving away from landline phones and towards cell phones.
